topic.title: Something like Wordpress for ZeroNet?
topic.body:
Hi!
I just wanted to ask if you know if there is something like wordpress or joomla I could use in ZeroNet to create a new Zite.
Thank you!

topic.title: IPFS- Have you tried it?
topic.body:
Hi everyone!
I just wanted to ask if you have tried IPFS, it seems to be good to upload heavy multimedia content. I think that ZeroNet + IPFS could be a good combination.
What do you think?

Cheers

topic.title: Background doesn't load in my Zite

1537956104_1HrQ48VceWqeGu9qmC2Y8VxUsGNSJ.body:
> [thunder33345](#comment_235_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): there's zeroblog http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/ which you can clone from

Thanks for answering!
That helps a lot, however, when I said something like wordpress, I was thinking about a website creation tool that allows me to install add-ons and do stuff like that.
Cheers.

1538004633_1Ny31DdkRx1wcA8bv2Uiybbex8YCX.body:
> [krixano](#comment_559_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): In ZeroHello, you can click the 3 dots next to the zite and click delete. You can also drag the 0 button on the top right to the left, scroll down, and there's a delete button there.

I didn't know the scroll down thing, thanks!

1538087340_1HrQ48VceWqeGu9qmC2Y8VxUsGNSJ.body: By the way, this is the picture I'm trying to set as background: https://imgur.com/d5piWBc . I have uploaded it to imgur just in case you wanna see it.

Thanks for your answers! Tomorrow I'll try the solutions you've suggested me and I'll tell you if it works :D
I'm sorry for asking such simple questions, but I'm new to all this things.

Thanks @styromaniac and @mrbetter !
The background finally loads! It seems to be that ZeroNet only publish images that are inside of the img folder. Until now, I've been trying to make it work thinking it was a coding mistake, but the only thing I had to do was move it to img folder and put the path on the css file. Take a look! :D http://127.0.0.1:43110/1E3x1bMj78DVgX5QoAYHc8ofEJbjX6LZ4o/

And thanks styromaniac for your message! Good to know that such nice people exist on this side of the internet. I'll keep learning as much as I can.

Cheers! 

PD: That thing about the link tag is pretty useful and interesting. It made things easier for me when I was making some changes in the code.

> [styromaniac](#comment_139_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): There's a way to increase root capacity, I believe, but I don't know it. I just work around it if I have to, but I don't use a large background image anymore. Did your background image get near or exceed 1MB?

It's weird, because the picture is only 52,8KB and I didn't get any error about the size of the background. Maybe I was doing something else wrong back then.

> [styromaniac](#comment_141_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Perhaps the URL pointed to wrong location and it was overlooked, or the cache thingy.

As far as I know, the URL was right because it worked on local. My supposition is that for some unknown reason the picture weren't uploaded to the ZeroNet network and when I moved it to the img folder, worked.
